content.rendered:
WORK@CGB

Experienced Secondary Business Management IGCSE/IBDP - Part-time role
International School in Bogotá offering the National Curriculum of England, International Primary Curriculum (IPC), International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC), IGCSE and the IB Diploma Programme requires qualified and experienced staff for this position to start on 1st August 2024.

Requirements:
-Degree in Business Management and or Education
-Experience in delivering the IBDP Business Management Curriculum
-Good communicator who values team work and has a demonstrated willingness to learn

Please submit C.V. & letter of application in English to:work@cgb.edu.co including the position applied for in the subject by 6th June 2024.
Experienced Secondary Teacher of Environmental Systems & Societies/Biology (IBDP) - preferably with experience in General Science
International School in Bogotá offering the National Curriculum of England, International Primary Curriculum (IPC), International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC), IGCSE and the IB Diploma Programme requires qualified and experienced staff for this position to start on 1st August 2024.

Requirements:
-Degree in Environmental Sciences and or Biology
-Experience in delivering the IBDP ESS Curriculum and or Biology
-Good communicator who values team work and has a demonstrated willingness to learn

Please submit C.V. & letter of application in English to:work@cgb.edu.co including the position applied for in the subject by 6th June 2024.
Profesor de Español
Colegio internacional en Bogotá con Currículo Nacional de Inglaterra, Internacional de Primaria (IPC), Internacional de Básica Secundaria (IMYC), IGCSE y el Programa de Diploma de Bachillerato Internacional, requiere personal calificado y con experiencia para el cargo de Profesor de Español (con experiencia enseñando a estudiantes de 10 a 15 años de edad) , con fecha de inicio el 1 de agosto de 2024.

Por favor envíe su hoja de vida y carta de solicitud a: work@cgb.edu.co incluyendo la posición para la que está aplicando antes del 6 de junio de 2024.
Learning Support Teacher/Psychologist
International School in Bogotá, offering the National Curriculum of England, International Primary Curriculum (IPC), International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC), IGCSE, and the IB Diploma Programme, requires qualified and experienced staff for the position of Learning Support Teacher/Psychologist. The position requires a bilingual (English/Spanish) Learning Support Teacher with experience working with students. The start date is 1st August 2024.

Requirements:
-Degree in Education and or Psychology
-Experience in providing Learning Support to students in a school setting
-Good communicator who values team work and has a demonstrated willingness to learn

Please submit C.V. & letter of application in English to:work@cgb.edu.co including the position applied for in the subject by 6th June 2024.
Learning Support Teacher - Mathematics specialist
International School in Bogotá, offering the National Curriculum of England, International Primary Curriculum (IPC), International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC), IGCSE, and the IB Diploma Programme, requires qualified and experienced staff for the position of Learning Support Teacher - Mathematics Specialist. The position requires a bilingual (English/Spanish) Learning Support Teacher with experience teaching Mathematics. The start date is 1st August 2024.

Requirements:
-Degree in Education and or Mathematics
-Experience in delivering Mathematics curriculum and/or providing Learning Support to students in a school setting
-Good communicator who values team work and has a demonstrated willingness to learn

Please submit C.V. & letter of application in English to:work@cgb.edu.co including the position applied for in the subject by 6th June 2024.
Learning Assistant- Bilingual (English/Spanish)
International School in Bogotá, offering the National Curriculum of England, International Primary Curriculum (IPC), International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC), IGCSE, and the IB Diploma Programme, requires qualified and experienced staff for the position of Learning Assistant. The position requires a bilingual (English/Spanish) Learning Assistant for Primary to support students and teachers in the primary classroom. The start date is 1st August 2024.

Requirements:
-Degree in Education and or Psychology
-Experience in working with children
-Good communicator who values team work and has a demonstrated willingness to learn

Please submit C.V. & letter of application in English to:work@cgb.edu.co including the position applied for in the subject by 6th June 2024.
Previous slide
Next slide
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and Interviews will commence on a rolling basis as applications are received and we reserve the right to appoint before the deadline should we find the ideal candidate. // Sólo los candidatos seleccionados serán contactados y las entrevistas iniciarán a medida que recibamos las aplicaciones. Nos reservamos el derecho de escoger antes de la fecha límite, en dado caso de encontrar el candidato ideal.
  • COLEGIO GRAN BRETAÑA IS COMMITTED TO THE PROTECTION AND SAFEGUARDING OF CHILDREN. ENHANCED BACKGROUND CHECKS ARE CARRIED OUT ON ALL EMPLOYEES IN ALL OF THE COUNTRIES IN WHICH THEY HAVE LIVED AND WORKED SINCE THE AGE OF 18. // EL COLEGIO GRAN BRETAÑA ESTÁ COMPROMETIDO CON LA SEGURIDAD Y PROTECCIÓN INFANTIL. POR LO TANTO, SE REALIZAN CONTROLES EXHAUSTIVOS DE LOS ANTECEDENTES DE TODOS LOS EMPLEADOS EN TODOS LOS PAÍSES EN LOS QUE HA VIVIDO Y TRABAJADO DESDE LA EDAD DE 18 AÑOS.
CGB CHILD PROTECTIONAND SAFEGUARDING POLICY
CLICK HERE
Our philosophy

Working at CGB is a unique experience that embraces diversity as one of its core values. We understand that our strength lies in our differences, and we actively work together to foster an environment where everyone can thrive. Our school’s Mission, Vision, Enduring Goals, and Foundation Blocks are the result of collaboration from all corners of our community. We uphold democratic principles in decision-making, ensuring that no single individual or minority group dictates our direction. We value the input of our students, staff, and families, and our doors are always open for discussions on our practices and initiatives.

At CGB, we are committed to creating a “No Bully Zone.” While challenges may arise, we have a robust anti-bullying policy in place to restore harmony within our community swiftly. Collaboration is key in maintaining this safe space where everyone is treated with respect and acceptance. We believe in modelling these behaviours because they are right, not just because they are rules. CGB is a dynamic community where a quarter of our members embark on new adventures each year while another quarter joins us for their own journey. We cherish the diversity that these transitions bring and work together to ensure that everyone feels part of the CGB family.

CGB is not just a school; it’s our home, and we are committed to providing the best learning experiences for our students, both inside and outside the classroom. Thank you for choosing to be a part of our CGB story.
